content.text:
# San Francisco Bay Area Film Critics Circle Awards 2020

19th SFBAFCC Awards
January 18, 2021
----
Picture:
Nomadland
----
Animated Feature:
Soul
----
Documentary:
Collective
----
Foreign Language Picture:
Another Round
The 19th San Francisco Bay Area Film Critics Circle Awards, honoring the best in film for 2020, were given on January 18, 2021.
Winners and nominees
, Best Director winner]]
, Best Actor winner]]
, Best Actress winner]]
, Best Supporting Actress winner]]
These are the nominees for the 19th SFFCC Awards. Winners are listed at the top of each list:
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%" | Best Film
!style="width=50%" | Best Director
|-
| valign="top" |
* Nomadland
** First Cow
** Minari
** Never Rarely Sometimes Always
** Promising Young Woman
| valign="top" |
* 'Chloé Zhao – Nomadland'
** Lee Isaac Chung – Minari
** Emerald Fennell – Promising Young Woman
** Eliza Hittman – Never Rarely Sometimes Always
** Kelly Reichardt – First Cow
|-
!style="width=50%" | Best Actor
!style="width=50%" | Best Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Chadwick Boseman – Ma Rainey's Black Bottom' (posthumously)
** Riz Ahmed – Sound of Metal
** Anthony Hopkins – The Father
** Delroy Lindo – Da 5 Bloods
** Steven Yeun – Minari
| valign="top" |
* 'Frances McDormand – Nomadland'
** Viola Davis – ''Ma Rainey's Black Bottom
** Sidney Flanigan – Never Rarely Sometimes Always
** Elisabeth Moss – The Invisible Man
** Carey Mulligan – Promising Young Woman
|-
!style="width=50%" | Best Supporting Actor
!style="width=50%" | Best Supporting Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Paul Raci – Sound of Metal'
** Chadwick Boseman – Da 5 Bloods (posthumously)
** Sacha Baron Cohen – The Trial of the Chicago 7
** Leslie Odom Jr. – One Night in Miami...
** David Strathairn – Nomadland
| valign="top" |
* 'Youn Yuh-jung – Minari'
** Maria Bakalova – Borat Subsequent Moviefilm
** Olivia Colman – The Father
** Toni Collette – I'm Thinking of Ending Things
** Amanda Seyfried – Mank
|-
!style="width=50%" | Best Adapted Screenplay
!style="width=50%" | Best Original Screenplay
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Jonathan Raymond and Kelly Reichardt – First Cow'
** Charlie Kaufman – I'm Thinking of Ending Things
** Kemp Powers – One Night in Miami...
** Ruben Santiago-Hudson – Ma Rainey's Black Bottom
** Chloé Zhao – Nomadland
| valign="top" |
* 'Lee Isaac Chung – Minari'
** Emerald Fennell – Promising Young Woman
** Jack Fincher – Mank (posthumously)
** Eliza Hittman – Never Rarely Sometimes Always
** Aaron Sorkin – The Trial of the Chicago 7
|-
!style="width=50%" | Best Animated Feature
!style="width=50%" | Best Documentary Film
|-
| valign="top" |
* Soul
** Marona's Fantastic Tale
** Onward
** Over the Moon
** Wolfwalkers
| valign="top" |
* Collective
** Boys State
** Crip Camp
** Time
** The Truffle Hunters
|-
!style="width=50%" | Best Foreign Language Film
!style="width=50%" | Best Cinematography
|-
| valign="top" |
* Another Round
** Bacurau
** Collective
** La Llorona
** Two of Us
| valign="top" |
* 'Christopher Blauvelt – First Cow'
** Erik Messerschmidt – Mank
** Joshua James Richards – Nomadland
** Newton Thomas Sigel – Da 5 Bloods
** Hoyte van Hoytema – Tenet
|-
!style="width=50%" | Best Film Editing
!style="width=50%" | Best Production Design
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Chloé Zhao – Nomadland'
** Alan Baumgarten – The Trial of the Chicago 7
** Kirk Baxter – Mank
** Jennifer Lame – Tenet
** Yorgos Lamprinos – The Father
| valign="top" |
* 'Anthony Gasparro and Vanessa Knoll – First Cow'
** Donald Graham Burt and Jan Pascale – Mank
** Nathan Crowley and Kathy Lucas – Tenet
** Janessa Hitsman and Mark Zuelzke – One Night in Miami...''
** Karen O'Hara and Mark Ricker – ''Ma Rainey's Black Bottom
|-
!style="width=50%" | Best Original Score
!style="width=50%" |
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Jon Batiste, Trent Reznor, and Atticus Ross – Soul'
** Terence Blanchard – Da 5 Bloods
** Terence Blanchard – One Night in Miami...
** Emile Mosseri – Minari
** Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross – Mank
| valign="top" |
|}
Special awards
Special Citation for Independent Cinema
* 'La Llorona, directed by Jayro Bustamante (TIE)
* S#!%house, directed by Cooper Raiff (TIE)'
** The Last Tree'', directed by Shola Amoo
Marlon Riggs Award
* Dawn Porter
